channel.title: Tailscale on Deuts Log
channel.description: Recent content in Tailscale on Deuts Log

item.title: Introducing the Tailscale Universal Docker Mod
item.description:
Introducing the Tailscale Universal Docker Mod

We created a universal Docker mod for Tailscale, which lets you slap Tailscale on the side of existing Docker containers from linuxserver.io. In this article, Xe explains how you can use this and why it’s funny.
item.content:encoded:
Introducing the Tailscale Universal Docker Mod

We created a universal Docker mod for Tailscale, which lets you slap Tailscale on the side of existing Docker containers from linuxserver.io. In this article, Xe explains how you can use this and why it’s funny.

item.title: Docker, Tailscale and Caddy with HTTPS. A love story!
item.description:
Docker, Tailscale and Caddy with HTTPS. A love story!

This details the Tailscale and Caddy setup as well as the should be Caddyfile content.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Remotely access and share your self-hosted services - YouTube
item.description:

item.title: Tailscale & Caddy for better admin security by Tim Nash
item.description:
Tailscale & Caddy for better admin security by Tim Nash

Securing a web app admin area, by combining Tailscale with MagicDNS split DNS feature, Systemd-resolved and Caddy.
item.content:encoded:
Tailscale & Caddy for better admin security by Tim Nash

Securing a web app admin area, by combining Tailscale with MagicDNS split DNS feature, Systemd-resolved and Caddy.

item.title: Contain your excitement: A deep dive into using Tailscale with Docker
item.description:
Contain your excitement: A deep dive into using Tailscale with Docker

Creating small, trusted networks with your friends, family and coworkers is central to our mission here at Tailscale. In this article we’re going to dive deep into using Docker to do just that, with containers.
item.content:encoded:
Contain your excitement: A deep dive into using Tailscale with Docker

Creating small, trusted networks with your friends, family and coworkers is central to our mission here at Tailscale. In this article we’re going to dive deep into using Docker to do just that, with containers.
